website_summaries.verdict: Featuring several clever accessories and attachments, this impressive filter prepares users for almost any outdoor adventure.
pros: Advanced purification system offers three stages of water filtration
Includes foldable water pouch, an extra straw for easy drinking, and a cleaning syringe
Handy carabiner attaches to water pouch
cons: Cleaning process is a little difficult
Water takes a while to get through straw

customer_reviews.title: this is awesome! The bag allows you to squeeze it and ...
customer_reviews.text: this is awesome! The bag allows you to squeeze it and force water thru the filter faster so you don't have to wait for the drip like other bagless models. I love it, and have tried it with seriously gross water and we were all fine!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Richard

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: As a former park ranger, I have used these in the backcountry and found them far preferable to iodine tablets. I bought this one for my emergency pack at home. With all the news about hurricanes this year, it just seemed like a good thing to have handy. The efficiency of the filter is very impressive. I like the ability to attach a water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Energyguy

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Hurricane Maria aid package
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for my family in Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. They had sent word of having to obtain drinking water directly from the river and streams. After package arrived, I liked the quality and ease of use, so I’ve decided to purchase two more for my at home survival kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Gave 1 of these to a friend to go on a mission trip to Haiti. He used one and his daughter the other. They were an instant hit. He wound up leaving them with the people that stay there. They said they were going to order some more of these. Great product. Life saver.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS COX

customer_reviews.title: I really love that it can connect to water bags for easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This turned out well for a backpacking trip I went on with my family. The first sip out of the sink tasted quite weird, but fresh flowing water from the mountains was delicious! I really love that it can connect to water bags for easy filtration. The water bag that comes with it is on the small size. I had a bigger one with the same cap I purchased from wal-mart. This came in very handing for filtering into water bottles or just taking water with you on the go.
customer_reviews.author: PLV

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: This filter really saved my butt on some hikes, including a long traverse through part of Shenandoah National Forest in Virginia. Many of the creeks were bone dry, except one that was very turbid. This filter took out all the sediment, cleansed the water, and gave us something to drink when we lacked an adequate supply of water on the second day of our journey. That's why us hikers keep something like this in our packs at all times!
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. Bosch

customer_reviews.title: It does work well
customer_reviews.text: Just took this on a 4 day backpacking trip although another in our group had a big water filtration system for everyone to use. Long story short, I got separated from the group and thus became an invaluable resource for me during that time. It does work, and the clip on the water pouch is nice. The bag the whole set comes in is flimsy and tore before I even left. The only other big thing is that the plastic the water pouch is made of is pretty robust, which makes it really hard to fill in a creek or lake.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter, Not So Great Assessories
customer_reviews.text: This is, in my opinion, the best water filter out there. I am an avid backpacker and have several other brands of water filters. What I like about this filter is it has an additional layer of filtration (charcoal) besides the standard membrane. The charcoal seems to take the "fishyness" out of the water. The only problem I have with this filter is that it does fit properly on every bag or bottle I have. The included bag is too small if you are filtering water on a long hike. Despite this, I always carry this filter and use my other brands as backups.
customer_reviews.author: SPW

customer_reviews.title: It's a good filter for emergencies and everything you need is in ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is what it is. It's a good filter for emergencies and everything you need is in the box. However, the threads don't work on most water bottles that I have tried so you have to use the bag....and hope that the bag lasts. There are much better filters out there for about $10 more such as the Katadyn Be free or the sawyer squeeze. I probably would not purchase again, but it's worth keeping in the trunk of your car for an emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainDrDr

customer_reviews.title: Light and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Like everything that can be used incorrectly, if you take your time in how you handle the filter and the several pieces used with the kit, it works just fine. I didn't drink from a septic tank, but I tried (carefully at first) your typical stream and pond water sources with it and as far as taste it was better than some bottled water brands sold these days. I would back wash (clean) the filter, blow LOW pressure air through it (by mouth or bicycle pump) and leave out to dry before putting caps back on. I believe this will reduce the possible musty flavor you can experience next time you camp with it. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: dalexander

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted one of these as an emergency or when outdoors. I opened it to get familiarize with it before taking it into the real world. I went camping but did get the chance to use it. Maybe I’ll do a follow up review when I get the chance to use it. As for now I like the options and accessories it comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Thavaro

customer_reviews.title: Works as should I'f your knowledgeable
customer_reviews.text: Thoughts straw has a mutch reduced life compared to a more recognized competitor. But as for function, it's fine. The people claiming tje can't draw through it most have zero jaw muscle. The filtered water when taken to county extension office tested safe after I pulled from the ditch behind house. I know there is always a risk but this did a good enough job.
customer_reviews.author: T Miller

customer_reviews.title: The biggest drawback is the amount of force that is ...
customer_reviews.text: The biggest drawback is the amount of force that is needed to get the water to flow through. Can't use it as a gravity purifier. But I have no complaints about the quality of water that comes out. Haven't seen any contaminants in my drinking water. But, do to the flow issue, it's more appropriate for a single person/bottle situation. And not a group/camp situation.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Hiker and ProspectorTop Contributor: Hiking

customer_reviews.title: Small, ultralight, easy to use, comprehensive accessories
customer_reviews.text: It's about the size of an average adult hand and weighs only 60g! The demo video on Amazon is super easy to understand so it's easy to use. The accessories that come with the product (listed in the posting already) are so useful, especially the light water bag. And follow the instructions on the manual within 7 days of purchase to get one extra year of warranty. Overall, highly highly highly recommended for outdoor trips.
customer_reviews.author: Yingfei Xin

customer_reviews.title: Hoping I'll never use it.
customer_reviews.text: When the apocalypse leaves me without clean drinking water I'll chip my review into a rock because I probably won't have internet or electricity then either... but at least I'll be prepared with potable water. Am I kidding? Only sort of... living in America is awesome right now you guys.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high tech, 3-stage filter at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality, high-tech portable water filter. It is competitive with much more expensive models. It uses replaceable pre-filters, carbon, then filter tubes to produce clean, good tasting water. Dissolved chemicals and mineral ions can get through so you should be selective about your water source. It should be fine for nearly all users and mine is a permanent resident in my bug out bag. At this price, what is stopping you?
customer_reviews.author: Flash Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Emergency Back Up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Etekcity Water Filter Straw with 1500L 3-Stage Filtration for my emergency back up closet. I figured I might need something in addition to my stored water supply; normal method of using remote clean water sources; and normal purification methods. I selected this product based on price, presentation, and specifications. Product arrive and appeared to be a quality product and as represented. I thought it best to keep the product sealed and stored until needed.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: excellent filter
customer_reviews.text: I chose this filter because of the antibacterial silver impregnated carbon filter along with the spare sediment filters and extension to. I appreciate the filter bottle included and I like to keep it as a backup to my primary filter or in case I'm on the go
customer_reviews.author: C Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Get more than one
customer_reviews.text: The picture does not give justice to the product and what all you get with it. This is a complete water system unlike the LifeStraw. This is more similar to the Sawyer System. I would recommend this to all and it is a bit less expensive than the LifeStraw.
customer_reviews.author: Prepper_T

customer_reviews.title: It worked on well water that required purification at Mt ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked on well water that required purification at Mt. San Jacinto. We didn't get sick. What more can be asked for?
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Moreno

customer_reviews.title: I expected it to be a larger device but small size makes for easy packing. It certainly can't do any good if ...
customer_reviews.text: They obviously gave some thought to needs and packaging. I expected it to be a larger device but small size makes for easy packing. It certainly can't do any good if it isn't convenient to take on the trip. Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Carman

customer_reviews.title: Don't go into the mountains without one.
customer_reviews.text: Used one on a week long elk hunt and worked awesome. Was 4.5 miles into a wilderness area and it was simple to refill my hydro pack as well as a small container for camp water. Takes a little time but works well. You drink more water than you think on a long hike and this can save you that dry last hour or two, and maybe your life.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze bag threads did not hold up when the plastic was warm.
customer_reviews.text: Used a few times, the temperature was in the upper 80's and the threads on the squeeze bottle were no longer holding to the filter (acted like it was stripped out or loose and was not sealing). Came home and figured the bag was going in the garbage, tested it in the mid 70's and it sealed just fine. I would not trust this to make potable water, but you can always just use it like a straw. Came home and found a used Katadyn Pocket filter for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Tycho

customer_reviews.title: Small and simple!
customer_reviews.text: The extension tube has bends in it due to the packing, it’s going to be tuff to pull water through bends in colder weather, But overall I I’m pleased, I haven’t tried the unit yet. I have tried other units before and had horrible results... I don’t want to name the company but let’s just say if I was camping that straw would not have given me life! Wink wink so I hope in the next week or so I can try the Etekcity personal water purifier in the field and leave a awesome review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great filter, cheap accessories
customer_reviews.text: Good water filter. I bought it for use on long hikes and it has come in extremely useful. My only criticism is the foldable water bottle that's included. The carabiner is cheap and likes to come undone. Also, the plastic on the bag is thin and was ripped by the carabiner while hanging from my bag. That said, I didn't buy this for the bag. I am more than happy with the filter itself. I look forward to many more adventures with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: Handy thing to have in an emergency kit. I don't know if I'd use it as my only source of water, but its small size, light weight, and efficacy make it a great choice in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: clean water!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lab to test the water quality that comes out of this filter but I'm happy to have it on backpacking hikes. it is somewhat slower than the other big brand all the other hikes have but on paper it does a better filtering job. note: I didn't try the bag that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: patrician

customer_reviews.title: Good product with better filter media pore size than some others of it's kind
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the product yet. But I spent some time comparing it's capability with some similar devices and purchased it. I wish it were just a little more substantial in construction. It feels as though it could easily break (although it has not)
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is easy enough for my 11 year old
customer_reviews.text: My son bought this because he aims to be a scientist one day. He also is involved in Boy Scouts and wanted to show off to the other campers. He loves it. It works great and is easy enough for my 11 year old. He takes it with him whenever he is camping. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Ethan H.

customer_reviews.title: Complete kit
customer_reviews.text: Great water filter to keep on hand for water emergencies. Unlike other similar products this is less costly and comes complete with carry bag hosing and a water container so it doesn’t leave you hanging with nowhere to store filtered water.
customer_reviews.author: joe natale

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item worked both the straw function with tube, and with the bag for filling up water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: David King

customer_reviews.title: It was nice to be able to roll up the bottle and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried the water bottle so far for my Europe trip. It was nice to be able to roll up the bottle and put it away when it's empty. It's a little weird carrying it since it's not like a solid bottle, but that's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: IPZ

customer_reviews.title: Small, simple to use, comes with options, ...
customer_reviews.text: Small, simple to use, comes with options, and seems very trustworthy to provide clean drinking water. My wife is going on a volunteer trip in Belize this summer, and I wanted her to have options while traveling in the jungle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hines

customer_reviews.title: This will be part of my home emergency kit. ...
customer_reviews.text: This will be part of my home emergency kit. In addition to the kit, the supplier sent an email with a very informative document on emergency preparedness.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got sick after using this straw to filter water in another country. DONT BUY! I wish I could return it but the return window closed while they were on their trip
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: cheap materials cap was broken when the package was opened.
customer_reviews.author: K. Xu

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: You have to clean it out regularly. I took it with me to South America for a month, and I didn't get sick, saved me frrom having to buy a lot of bottled water. Drank from a stream at the bottom of Machu Picchu.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Used this as my primary means of filtering water on a 3 day hike up/down Mt Whitney. Well made, light, and effective. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Strickland

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ALL AROUND PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Great product, especially for the price! Lightweight, easy to use & clean, comes with all the needed accessories, & a travel pouch. Worked just as described & I was able to drink from a glacier pool on the South Sister in Oregon.
customer_reviews.author: YDNAREMIS

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. A little something to throw in the car in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jaworski

customer_reviews.title: It worked, but...
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance to use this filter on a recent 2 day backpacking trip. Bottom line it worked. Deducted a star because it leaked a bit at the inlet connection when using *the foldable water pouch*. It's plastic so I was wary of over-tightening. Disappointing but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: AZ_backpacker

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One went into an emergency pack in the car, this one went with me on a hunting trip. It was a great value for the price and I cans ee myself using it many more times.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lee

customer_reviews.title: emergency kit backpack
customer_reviews.text: I got it for our grab and go bag. There are lots of weather emergencies here and they are always telling you the kinds of things we will need in case we are isolated etc. The instructions seem straight forward and it does not take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: My boys and I like to canoe and thought this would be a cool addition to our day packs. We couldn't wait to try it out. First with tap water, then water from the pool cover. Reasonable amount of suction required and no discernible difference in taste between the two waters. 24 hrs since we drank the stagnant water from the pool. Must be working, Thank God! I'd rather find out now than out on a backpacking or camping trip. Back flush was also easy. I've never used anything like this, but it appears to be a good product. I will get a small ditty bag to keep the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: kdrappo

customer_reviews.title: Great addition
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try this side by side with the LifeStraw. This has slightly less draw than the life straw, however the ability to hook it up to water bottles and extend the length with the hose. Only down side I see is it is only good for one year once you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M Hansen

customer_reviews.title: As Described
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for our son. It looks great. It was highly rated and is exactly how it is described. We also got it on time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will travel well.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need is in the box. Comes with travel poch. Easy instructions. Now lets hope it kills the bacteria.
customer_reviews.author: ladyladd2001

customer_reviews.title: Great substitute for water bottles
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried it out yet but ordered these for my family to use for our emergency go bags. Great size and will last for a long time if needed. Great substitute for actual water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Jjbowersock

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this purifier works great. Tried it with muddy water and worked great the accessories bag works great to. The syringe could be a little bigger like my lifesraw flex purifier but still a great product that works. Works just as good as my lifestraw
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Attachments
customer_reviews.text: It has attachments that come with it to make reaching water easier to reach. Also it has the items you need to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Mayo Haskett

customer_reviews.title: Decided to purchase the Etekcity and am throughly pleased. Provides extra comfort for me to know each ...
customer_reviews.text: Researched several personal water filtration device for myself and family. Decided to purchase the Etekcity and am throughly pleased. Provides extra comfort for me to know each of us have our own clean water to drink. Each of us have our own during all our outdoor adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Your Brother Man

customer_reviews.title: Water filter
customer_reviews.text: Never used or tried. Assume it will work if I ever need it. Have it for emergency circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Iconoclast

customer_reviews.title: Comes With All The Extras
customer_reviews.text: Lucky to get this as a deal of day Everything well made. Tried it out and seems to be fine. I had a little trouble inhaling water thru it, but thats because of my bad health. Great Product, Everyone needs one.
customer_reviews.author: sightsandsounds

customer_reviews.title: I like the product but, would like to see an indicator window showing when it needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, and, seller shipped quickly! I like the product but, would like to see an indicator window showing when it needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, operates essentially as the same in all brands
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, operates essentially as the same in all brands... only peev is the size of the filter tube, comparable brands have managed to make their's a tidbit shorter... but this one works!
customer_reviews.author: John Kincer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea bad implementation.
customer_reviews.text: I was using it on 2 weeks hike. It is good for an emergency, but it is not good for every day. Squeeze Pouch is flimsy and falt apart after 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: SKV

customer_reviews.title: will put it in my bug out bag but it seems to be a useful water filter do not think I can filter a ...
customer_reviews.text: have not used, hope I never have to, will put it in my bug out bag but it seems to be a useful water filter do not think I can filter a lot of water at a time but enough to keep hydrated in a pinch
customer_reviews.author: mike m

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well, and easily this worked. I’m not sure I would trust any of these type of filters in actual filthy water but for the creeks and streams where I hike, this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wilson

customer_reviews.title: i like the completeness of this one over the others and ...
customer_reviews.text: i have three different types of water filters currently. i am a big believer in "MURPHY'S LAW", in that, you don't prepare, it'll then happen. Out of the three, i like the completeness of this one over the others and it is less expensive. Now, don't change your pricing. You'll sell a lot more than the other guys by keeping it competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This filter is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this water filter. I have used them before and they provide the best virus protection and make the water tastes better because of the carbon filter.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Conerly

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Both of us got very sick using it. Literally ended up being a piece of plastic in the backpack. Bought over a year ago, catching up on old reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: No more bad water
customer_reviews.text: Keep it with you if you don't trust the drinking water, stay healthy
customer_reviews.author: Green Parrot

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use as a straw
customer_reviews.text: excessive force is needed to get the smallest amount of water through the system not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully we never need this but if we do it will be a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Meyers

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: Overall good filter but water pouch broke after about 5 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Tried it with some homemade muddy water and it did come through very clear I was able to drink it there was a little musty taste but didn't hurt me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M..

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality and all the accessories that you would need. Thanks for a good product and customer service!
customer_reviews.author: znolan

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: It works great, price is awesome, for the money you could not buy a better filtration
customer_reviews.author: Gil B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The water comes clean no bad taste no odors best value for your money
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Montes

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only tried it at home. I am leaving on an extended trip in Nov 2019 and will certainly take it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: Have a few one for home. And my car BOB and main BOB this kit is awesome
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this water filter for weekend hiking were weight and size isn't an issue. I feel this product has everything I will need and more I'm looking forward to testing it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: better than most straw filtration devices because you can backwash and clean the filter
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! Doesn't take too long and gets the job done!!
customer_reviews.author: Brit grainger

customer_reviews.title: Good reviews from current users and the number of uses possible.
customer_reviews.text: Good reviews and a good price. Purchased for home emergency use and to take on vacations to areas where safe drinking water could be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable water filter
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to keep with a survival kit we have just in case we ever need it. It small enough to travel with and will work in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: Renee MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I would like the ability to fill a container with clean water
customer_reviews.text: I would like the ability to fill a container with clean water, say the bladder that came with it instead of sucking on the tube all the time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great straw, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great straw, great price! I have purchased 4 or 5 these and stashed them in vehicles, boats hunting packs, and emergency kits. Clean water is quite important.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: High Hopes
customer_reviews.text: This straw just won't suck well enough, I am happy with Sawyer products
customer_reviews.author: david piteri

customer_reviews.title: Fits coke bottles too.
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I'm writing this review is to tell you guys that this filter also fits the normal 500ml Coke bottle. Because the reviews that I've come across all say that you can screw it on to the smart water bottle but I wasn't sure if it would fit the normal coke or sprite bottle. Anyway it fits, so I'm really happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Leong

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for Hiking trips. Feel safer knowing we have this
customer_reviews.author: N.Alexandriia

customer_reviews.title: Good for traveling four stars
customer_reviews.text: The taste of it tasted like chemicals when I tried to clean it and didn't clean it didn't come out the other side when I use the thing to clean it that came with it
customer_reviews.author: Eugene P Roberts III

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, very easy to understand, we'll made, happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gass Sr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet but everything looked as in picture and had no smell or damage.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice water filter but I like my swayer mini better. Plus is the carbon filter and carry sack. Cons bigger then swayer mini takes longer to back flush.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Henning

customer_reviews.title: Very happy as described
customer_reviews.text: haven't used it yet have it just in case but it seems to be a very good product
customer_reviews.author: bigbowser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, hope to never need but there if I do.
customer_reviews.author: ryan murphy

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Handy reasonable size and easily packable. Great to have in emergencies and on camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M.

customer_reviews.title: Not the fastest but works if you need it
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose but was really slow. My friend had a much smaller and faster filter. I didn’t get sick drinking water I filtered from a river but it was a lot of work filtering 100 oz.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. I'm trying to figure out how to fill water bottles/ Camelback with clean water. I'll look for a hand pump.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kuptz

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used on a backpacking weekend trip. Didn’t get sick!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Watts

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight oh, I have not used it yet but looks like it would be really nice
customer_reviews.author: Keith  Niedermeier

customer_reviews.title: Did not screw on to a a standard 24 oz water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and very thoughtful to include a backwash capability to extend the life and capacity. I had also hoped to use in camp where a suspended bottle could gravity feed into another bottle but the filter did not mate with my standard 24 oz bottle.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Groundbreaking technology
customer_reviews.text: Went backpacking this weekend and it was great to have.....inexpensive, lightweight and worked flawlessly! As a infectious diseases and public health physician, I resoundingly support this technology. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: scott Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: not very useful
customer_reviews.text: It only works with the container they provide. Not very helpful when you need to carry several water bottles. jh
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Great size and capacity
customer_reviews.text: Size is great for storing a couple of these in case of an emergency
customer_reviews.author: David Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the plastic bag
customer_reviews.text: This was great until the plastic bag it came with broke. I would suggest buying extra bags! Other than that, it worked great and we were able to drink from the river over our two day hike. We are just glad it broke towards the end of the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That it’s light weight and has extra filters for the unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried it yet I got for my bugout bag or emergencies. Do you have refill filters
customer_reviews.author: SHARON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice straw. It will be perfect for when my husband is working in Alaska at the gold camp.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyrella

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: Great little filter. Small price for survival if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

product_meta.title: Etekcity Water Filter Straw Camping Water Purification Portable Water Filter Survival Kit for Camping, Hiking, Emergency, Hurricane
product_meta.description: Etekcity camping water filter straw is ideal for emergency and outdoor use. Safely drink up to 1, 500 liters of water from nearly any lake, river, spring, well or even rainwater with up to 4 different uses including filter extension, portable water storage and prefiltration. The Personal Water Filter by Etekcity filters 99. 9999% of heavy metal ions, remained chlorine, VOC, organic and insect contaminant. Take your outdoor explorations to the next level with Etekcity Portable Water Filter. You can hook your water filter straw to the pouch and fill the pouch with the available water, even if it isn't clean. Just attach the water filter straw to the hydration backpack you already own and drink water from lakes, ponds, rivers and streams. Etekcity Camping Water Filter Straw comes with all needed accessories for emergency and adventure. Specifications Net Weight: 60g Dimensions: Φ31 X 160mm Output: 400 ml/min Capacity: 1500L / 1 year (from first use) Package Content 1 x Personal Water Purifier 1 x Foldable Water Bag with D type hook 1 x 70 cm Extension Tube 1 x Pre-filtration devise(with 1 PP Cotton Pad) 4 x PP Cotton Pads 1 x Backwash Device 1 x User Manual
feature_bullets: SAFETY TESTED: Etekcity water purifier has been tested by German TüV SüD Examination Institute and meet EPA Water Quality Standards. The pouch is FDA Compliant in accordance with 21 CFR 180. 22 to ensure maximum quality and safety

ADVANCED FILTRATION DESIGN: Pre-filter to defense large contaminants. Ion-exchange resin to remove chlorine, heavy metal ions, THMs. Activated carbon to eliminate odors. 0. 01Μm hollow fiber UF inline Membrane to filter 99. 9999% waterborne rubbish

DEPENDABLE ACCESSORIES: Prepared with a Foldable Water Pouch(480ML, 16oz) with D type hook, an Extension Tube(70cm), a Syringe(back wash device), an Inlet Mouthpiece(pre-filtration device with 1 PP Cotton Pad), additional Four PP Cotton Pads
HIGH FILTER CAPACITY: Etekcity Water Filter Straw provides up to 1500L of safe drinking water and the water yield can be 400ML/min
IDEAL GEAR: Small and lightweight(2. 08oz), perfect for camping, backpacking, scouting and more. Store for emergency preparedness
